column5: I have a canoe that is powered by a 3.3 hp gas that I just bought. I have a 30 day in-transit in my home state. Can I get this across the boarded and will the Canadian Officials give me any grief on the water with a noterized Bill of Sale?

[font color=green size=3][b]In NWO a small boat with less than I beleive a 10 hp dosen't need registration, the only hassle would be if you sell or leave it for more than 45 days, then they want some tax money. Wish'in I was fish'in on Wabby
Doubt you'll have any problems with that. I never have had.

Thanx Fellas I appriciate the info. It has really turned into a mess. 1) no hull ID #-- 4-6 wait to get one-- it's a canoe 2) no title on the boat-- police check-- it's a canoe 3) Bill of sale not noterized-- got that one taken care of

I wouldn't worry about it. Canoes are not registered in Ontario I'm pretty sure. I have a 12 ft. boat w/ 9.9 that we keep up @ our camp that doesn't need registration. once you go 10hp and up is when you need #'s on them. Have a great trip !
